concept.title: Data Policies
concept.shortdesc: The data policy provides several key items of information about a data source.

conbody.p: The data policy describes what type and format of data is expected from the data source and to what data category the information belongs. It also lists the users who are responsible for various aspects of the information.

The data policy also specifies the privacy settings for the data source. It specifies one of the configured data visibilities, which describes the sensitivity of the data. The data policy also specifies which access policy (if any) will be used to enforce rightful access to the information. All raw data ingested from this source, as well as every item of derived data, will be tagged with the specified data visibility and access policy, to protect its privacy.

The data policy is also where the organization's data sharing agreement is recorded. The data sharing agreement should certify that the information under consideration is allowed to reside on the PHEMI system. You upload the agreement as a document and specify the time period for which the agreement is valid.

The data policy also records the retention rules to be applied to information from this data source. The system uses the retention rules to calculate a time to live for each data item. When the time to live expires, deleted the raw data and all associated derived data items from the data store.
If you want your information version-controlled, the data policy is the place where you enable version control.
